revised_title: Investigating the Combination Curves, Hydrogen Ion Regulating Power, and Equivalents of Ovalbumin
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the combination curves, hydrogen ion regulating power, and equivalents of ovalbumin. They found that the combination curve of ovalbumin is slightly more variable than that of other proteins, and it has a higher buffering capacity. The study also revealed differences in the buffering power and denaturation of fresh and aged ovalbumin.
